translation.en: [man] We're gonna take our time. We're gonna move slow.
Uh, we're just worried about booby traps mostly.
And obviously we're missing one body, so be very alert
translation.ko: 시신 한 구가 부족한 걸 잊지 말도록

translation.en: because there could be a live one.
Okay, clear.
Clear.
We have some sort of barricade here, we don't know why.
translation.ko: 바리케이드 같은 게 있는데 용도는 모르겠다

translation.en: Maybe a last stronghold.
This is Control Center Three
at the far east end of L-Block.
This is the doorway outside of L-8,
the entrance to L-8.
[man 2] It's empty, Sergeant.
-Ready? -[man] Yeah.
Look behind it. See there's nothing wired to it.
translation.ko: 뒤에 전선 같은 거 없는지 잘 살펴

translation.en: This is L-7.
[man on TV] The new prison at Lucasville
is one of the largest in the United States.
It cost more than $23 million to build.
It will hold 1,600 prisoners.
The new maximum security prison has the latest equipment,
translation.ko: 신축 교도소는 전기로 작동하는 게이트와 유치장 출입구 등

translation.en: electronically controlled gates and cell block doors,
and the presence of the new prison is already being felt
in the town of Lucasville, a small community
on the fringe of Appalachia.
In the 1920s, this was a prosperous community.
But then came the Depression.
Steel mills closed down, and the railroad didn't stop here anymore.
translation.ko: 제철소와 기차역이 폐쇄된 바 있는 루커스빌은

translation.en: Lucasville never really recovered,
but they're hoping that the new prison will change all that.
translation.ko: 주민들은 새 교도소가 일으킬 변화를 기대 중입니다

translation.en: There are 400 jobs available at the prison.
There have been 2,400 applications for those jobs.
[man on radio] ...those storms could be strong to severe
translation.ko: 이번 태풍은 매우 강력하며 “미국 오하이오 루커스빌”

translation.en: and accompanied by high wind and hail
translation.ko: “미국 오하이오 루커스빌” 강풍과 우박, 국지적인 토네이도를 동반할 수 있습니다

translation.en: and it could spawn an isolated tornado.
translation.ko: 강풍과 우박, 국지적인 토네이도를 동반할 수 있습니다

translation.en: I'd done ten years in the military, and I needed a job when I got out.
translation.ko: 10년간의 군 복무를 마친 터라 새 직장이 필요했어요

translation.en: Really not a whole lot of choices of employment around here.
translation.ko: 사실 여긴 일거리가 다양한 곳은 아니에요

translation.en: I wanted a good job. I wanted health benefits, dental benefits.
I had two small kids.
This was one of the good jobs around here in this whole area.
translation.ko: 교도관은 이 근방을 통틀어 가장 괜찮은 일자리였어요

translation.en: [Mike Hensley] It's not a job for everybody.
translation.ko: 누구나 할 수 있는 일은 아니죠

translation.en: When you're inside, you're locked up just like they are.
translation.ko: 일단 들어가면 죄수처럼 갇혀 있어야 하거든요

translation.en: -It's a whole different world... -[cell door buzzes]
and we're not talking about guys that just broke a traffic law or something.
translation.ko: 교통 규칙 같은 사소한 걸 위반해서 온 사람들이 아니라

translation.en: We're talking about pedophiles, murderers,
guys that really do not play well with others, period.
And if they sense weakness,
if they even think that you're afraid of them...
then they'll act on that weakness.
There's animals in there.
I mean, there's people in there that are just truly animals.
When that gate closes, you could go home at night,
-or you couldn't go home at night. -[cell door buzzes]
It was really up to the inmates.
[man] Lucasville was a dangerous place, man. It was very dangerous.
translation.ko: 루커스빌은 험한 곳이에요 흉악하기 짝이 없죠

translation.en: It was the most dangerous institution in the state of Ohio at that time.
translation.ko: 당시 오하이오 주에서 제일 살벌한 교도소였다니까요

translation.en: You're in a place that people get killed on a regular basis.
translation.ko: 거기선 허구한 날 사람들이 죽어 나갔어요

translation.en: I mean, there was so much drugs in Lucasville
that you'd think you was on the street.
It's a place with a turbulent past.
In 1973, just one year after it opened,
two prison guards were killed by inmates.
Almost three years ago, an inmate at Lucasville killed a teacher
in a restroom at the prison's learning center.
Inmate Eddie Vaughn stabbed 32-year-old Beverly Taylor
translation.ko: 에디 본이 직접 만든 칼로 베벌리 테일러를

translation.en: with a homemade knife.
Vaughn had been serving a sentence for murder.
[Rodger Snodgrass] You're on your way to chow, minding your business...
translation.ko: 밥 먹으러 내 갈 길 가고 있는데

translation.en: ...next thing you know, the guy behind you
grabs the guy in front of you and cuts his throat.
translation.ko: 앞에 가던 놈 목을 따는 거예요

translation.en: [laughs] You know what I mean?
It's like you had to constantly watch everyone.
It was very-- A very volatile place, man.
[man] I get a call one day
translation.ko: 어느 날 전화 한 통을 받았어요

translation.en: from the director of corrections in Ohio at the time.
I think I ask him, I said, "I'm not in some kind of trouble, am I, Director?"
And he said, "No, sir, you're not."
He said...
"The reason I've called you up here is that I want--
I'm gonna send you to Lucasville."
It wasn't, "Would you like to go to Lucasville?"
It just took the wind out of my sails.
Everybody in the system knew that Lucasville was really, really having a lot of problems.
translation.ko: 루커스빌에 문제가 많다는 건 그쪽 사람들은 다 알았거든요

translation.en: Prisons are challenging in and of themselves,
translation.ko: 원래 교도소 일이라는 게 어디든 다 힘들지만

translation.en: but this was gonna be the... [stammers]
crème de la crème of challenges for me.
So, I wasn't happy.
When the prison was built, it had roughly 1,600 cells.
translation.ko: 교도소가 지어졌을 때는 감방이 약 1,600개였는데 “오하이오 남부 교도소”

translation.en: And when I got there, it seemed to me like there were 2,000 inmates,
2,100, somewhere thereabouts.
[man on TV] Ohio's Lucasville Prison
is one of the newest prisons, but like others, overcrowded.
Cells built for one prisoner had to be shared by two,
ten-and-a-half feet by six-and-a-half feet.
[Hensley] Now you had your Aryan Brotherhood,
you had your Black Gangster Disciples,
you had a little bit of the Crips, a little bit of Bloods in there...
...and you had your black Muslim inmates.
And they would have tension amongst themselves.
I had three separate inmates get their throats cut
translation.ko: 부임하고 첫 5일 사이에 재소자 셋의 목이 잘렸어요

translation.en: in the first five days.
It was out of control.
Lucasville was like a world within itself.
We was running wild, doing what we want. Pants hanging out, no badge on, no ID on,
translation.ko: 이름표, 번호표 다 떼놓고 빤스는 바지 밖으로 내놓고

translation.en: walking up and down halls, knives in our shirt and everything.
translation.ko: 윗도리엔 칼 같은 걸 숨겨서 교도소 복도를 활보했어요

translation.en: We was living like that.
That was normal for Lucasville.
That wasn't normal for those other prisons.
These people here, they already know there's no going home.
translation.ko: 근데 여기 사람들은 다들 다신 못 나갈 거 알았거든요

translation.en: I made some really tough decisions...
to try to effect some control over a place that has just literally been off the hook.
translation.ko: 어떻게든 질서를 잡아 보려고 결단을 내렸어요

translation.en: Curtailment of programs, mandatory drug tests...
translation.ko: 교육 프로그램 단축 약물 테스트 의무화

translation.en: escorted movement everywhere.
translation.ko: 이동 시 감독관 동행 등을 시행했죠

translation.en: [Snodgrass] This guy coming in here, and he's making it his job
translation.ko: 새로 온 교도소장은 아주 작정을 하고

translation.en: to step on our necks, all right, any way he can.
translation.ko: 우리 목을 틀어쥐었어요 별의별 수단을 다 썼죠

translation.en: I don't know. Tate just made it a different joint, man,
and the guys wasn't liking it.
Inmates took on the mentality,
"Nah, hell nah.
We're not accepting that shit, right?"
[Art Tate] Lucasville was an explosive environment...
every day.
While all this tension is going on,
the need that came down from the department...
"We're gonna start testing all inmates
in the Ohio prison system for tuberculosis."
Well, the Muslim inmates...
indicated that they weren't gonna take this test.
It was verbally told to me by several of the guys that,
"Look, we've got some guys that you're probably gonna have to use force."
translation.ko: ‘완력을 써도 말 안 들을 놈들이 제법 될 거요’

translation.en: [man] Hello. Can you hear me?
No, I can't hear you, but can-- can you shake your head if you can hear me?
translation.ko: 잘 안 들려요 들리면 고개를 끄덕여 봐요

translation.en: Can you hear me? Okay.
All right, I see you a lot better now. Okay, go ahead.
Taking the TB test was an infringement on our rights as believers in Islam.
translation.ko: 결핵 검사는 이슬람교도의 권리를 침해하는 행위예요

translation.en: It contains phenol. Phenol is an alcoholic substance.
translation.ko: 검사 약물엔 페놀이 들어가고 페놀은 알코올 성분이 있죠

translation.en: In Islamic belief, it is not permissible to consume alcohol,
to use alcohol, to transport alcohol.
[Snodgrass] You know, Hasan's a really quiet guy. All right?
He don't talk much, but when he does, everybody listens because, you know,
translation.ko: 말수는 적었지만 한번 말하면 다들 집중해서 들었죠

translation.en: he's got a lot of polish. He was educated.
[Siddique Abdullah Hasan] Just because you are a prisoner
and the doors and gates are closed behind you,
it does not forfeit you of your constitutional rights.
translation.ko: 헌법이 보장한 권리까지 박탈해선 안 되죠

translation.en: Tate was not willing to listen to us
because he cannot allow prisoners, or us in particular,
the Muslim body, to dictate to him how he run his institution.
translation.ko: 자기의 교도소 운영 방식에 반기를 드는 게 싫었겠죠

translation.en: [Tate] I picked up the telephone, called Columbus and said,
"We need to talk.
This is not going well down here.
I can tell you we're gonna have problems."
They said, "Go back and handle it."
I had put together a very thorough plan.
I was gonna lock the prison down the day after Easter,
and over that three-day period, we were gonna take teams of people
translation.ko: 3일에 걸쳐 팀원들을 교도소 각 구역에 투입해

translation.en: into the different cell houses and affect the test
right in the inmate's cell.
[Ronnie Owens] We have clerks, convicts,
working right there in the offices...
was hear things.
They'd come back and tell their brothers,
somebody can tell the Muslims,
and so on and so forth.
That they're gonna lock y'all down.
[man] I came in the kitchen to get--
Well, I came to eat, but I was also picking up some weed, some marijuana.
translation.ko: 먹을 것도 챙기고 마리화나도 구해야 했거든요

translation.en: And the guy that gave me the marijuana said,
translation.ko: 근데 거기 있던 놈이 마리화나를 주며 그랬어요

translation.en: "Man, we're making up a lot of sandwiches and bagged lunches back here."
He said, "They're gonna lock the institution down Monday...
and gonna feed everybody in their cell
and make everybody take their TB test."
So I said, "Well, look..."
I said, "Man, bring me two bags of weed...
uh, this evening to the dining hall."
So I would make sure I would be cool during the lockdown.
translation.ko: 폐쇄된 동안 피울 건 챙겨 놔야 하니까

translation.en: These Muslims felt like...
"Well, if we're gonna make a stand against the administration,
then we need to do it on a day and a time that affects them the most."
translation.ko: 타격을 최대로 할 수 있는 타이밍을 노리자고 했어요

translation.en: They knew that Arthur Tate, he's gonna be home eating Easter dinner
translation.ko: 놈들은 교도소장이 부활절에 식구들이랑 저녁을 먹으려고

translation.en: with his kids and his wife and stuff,
and that it was gonna be low on security
translation.ko: 바로 그때가 보안이 제일 취약할 때였어요

translation.en: because a lot of officers took that day off.
I was only five days away from a transfer.
It was just kind of an average, boring day to start with.
[Snodgrass] I was a rec worker, and I had access to a lot of,
you know, things that the Muslims wanted, and one of them was ball bats.
translation.ko: 이슬람 죄수들이 찾던 물건들을 구하기가 쉬웠어요

translation.en: On this day, we broke out about 25 ball bats
translation.ko: 그날 야구 배트를 25개 정도 챙겨 나왔죠

translation.en: that weren't even supposed to be out.
When the Muslims come in, we handed 'em ball bats.
I waited until about six or seven of 'em had them...
and they went right through the door and started at the metal detector,
beat the guards down
-and hit them with the ball bats. -[officer] Hey, get down!
[inmate] Fuck you! Say your prayers, motherfucker! -[blows landing] -[man grunting]
They really messed them up, you know.
[Hensley] It was real quiet.
There wasn't no music. There was no TVs playing.
translation.ko: 음악도, TV 소리도 전혀 안 들렸죠

translation.en: Kind of an eerie feeling, and something caught my eye.
translation.ko: 찜찜한 기분이 들었어요 그러다 뭔가를 봤죠

translation.en: I'd seen inmates running.
The inmates aren't allowed to run.
They're not allowed to run anywhere in that institution.
[Kenneth Daniels] We had a call go across the radio
translation.ko: 우리 구역 통로로 가라는 무전이 들어왔어요

translation.en: that there was a fight in our corridor.
And the first thing I see is inmates running up,
translation.ko: 그 직후에 죄수들이 저더러 그쪽으로 가지 말라면서

translation.en: saying, "Don't go down there."
-I went on to do my job. -[blows landing]
And I found an officer that was getting beat by an inmate.
Somebody beat me in the head. Somebody put cuffs on me.
translation.ko: 누군가 제 머리를 치고 수갑을 채웠어요

translation.en: And, uh...
But once the handcuffs went on, I knew it was--
it was wrong, and it was way out of control.
translation.ko: 걷잡을 수 없는 일이 벌어진 겁니다

translation.en: [DeWayne Guynes] With this many officers getting beat,
translation.ko: 간수들이 여럿 맞아 나가는 걸 보니

translation.en: I know we're fittin' to get locked down or worse.
translation.ko: 최소 독방, 아니면 그보다 더한 일을 당하겠구나 싶었죠

translation.en: I'm trying to get to my cell...
to get the weed.
I wanna hurry up and consume my stuff before reinforcements come in.
translation.ko: 지원 병력 오기 전에 잽싸게 해치우고 싶었거든요

translation.en: [Tate] I had been invited by some friends to Easter dinner, and the phone rang.
translation.ko: 부활절 만찬 초대를 받아서 친구 집에 있는데

translation.en: It was a friend of mine, and she said, "Art...
I don't know what's going on, but something's happening at Lucasville."
translation.ko: 뭔지는 모르지만 루커스빌에 일이 생긴 거 같다고요

translation.en: I called the prison.
One of my deputies answered the phone.
He was almost incoherent.
"Warden, uh, we're having a major riot. The inmates are on the fence.
translation.ko: 대규모 폭동이 일어나서 죄수들이 담장에 올라가고

translation.en: The inmates got the keys. They're on the roof."
I'm thinking, "Oh, my God."
And I drove like a bat out of hell to Lucasville.
The next thing I knew, -the doors start opening. -[door opening]
The consoles, somebody was at the consoles.
All the doors opened up.
And I looked down on the bottom wings...
and I see these guys, they had their face covered up, masked men.
And there was a guy downstairs,
and they was beating him with a crowbar,
translation.ko: 어떤 놈을 쇠 지렛대로 두들겨 패고 있고

translation.en: and he was begging for his life.
But he was a snitch. He should have been dead a long time ago.
translation.ko: 놈은 밀고자였어요 진작에 죽어도 싼 놈이죠

translation.en: And they killed him right there.
[inmate] Snitching bitch! Kill that motherfucker!
Snitches get ditches.
[Guynes] Once they hit the doors and let everybody out,
translation.ko: 일단 감방문이 열리니까 너나 할 것 없이 몰려 나와서

translation.en: there were a lot of old vendettas... being settled.
I'm sitting thinking about all the things,
translation.ko: 보다 보니 오만 생각이 다 드는데

translation.en: and it's hard for me to explain all at once,
but I can tell you this.
It was the most chaotic and, uh...
violent and dangerous situation that I've ever seen in my life.
Four-hundred, 500 guys running around
extremely hyped up and mad.
Those inmates were burning files.
That way they ain't got no information on us when this is all over and shit.
translation.ko: 폭동이 끝나고 문제가 될까 봐 자기들 정보를 없앤 거죠

translation.en: It was just madness.
People just started breaking up everything...
figuring, "If we tear all this up, that means we can't live here.
translation.ko: 다 때려 부수면 거기 더 못 있게 되니까

translation.en: So that means we going somewhere.
I don't know about going home, but we're gonna leave here."
translation.ko: 집에는 못 가더라도 여기만큼은 뜨자는 심산이었어요

translation.en: What was intended to be a peaceful protest
translation.ko: 주 정부 교정국의 주목을 받으려고 시작한

translation.en: to gain the attention of central office
became a full-scale rebellion.
That was never part of the plan.
[Tate] In training, the officers were taught,
translation.ko: 교도관 훈련 내용엔 이런 게 있어요

translation.en: God forbid, if you're ever in a hostage situation...
lock yourself in the backroom. It's a safe haven.
translation.ko: 밀실에 몸을 숨기라고요 거긴 안전한 피난처죠

translation.en: You call the control center and help will come.
translation.ko: 그리고 컨트롤 센터에 연락하면 지원을 받게 돼요

translation.en: The wall between that room
and the cell house was supposed to have been rebarred.
Well, the inmates... -they punched through those walls... -[glass shatters]
...like you were cutting through hot butter.
There was no rebar.
[Hensley] That little room filled up quick with inmates, and they were all armed.
And we lost that fight pretty quick.
Once they got us under control,
they basically covered our faces, and tied us up,
translation.ko: 우리 얼굴을 가리고 손을 포박한 다음

translation.en: and put us in the shower.
[man 1] Fuck you! Fuck you. [man 2] Take it easy.
translation.ko: - 빌어먹을 - 둘 다 내 말 들어!

translation.en: After I smoked that weed...
and went back into the block,
I noticed you got five or six guards
just sitting on the floor down in the shower, cuffed up.
[stammers] This is, you know... It's kind of deep.
-[man groaning] -[inmate] Get your fucking head down!
[Daniels] They took our wallets and keys, dressed us in inmate clothing.
[inmate] Shut the fuck up!
I felt like I'd had my identity stripped away.
I was just now another inmate.
[Hensley] My partner said, "What are we gonna do?"
I said, "Make your peace now, 'cause we're getting ready to die."
translation.ko: 마음 가라앉히고 죽을 각오나 하자고 했어요

translation.en: [Guynes] It's a wonder that the riot didn't kick off way before it did.
translation.ko: 그런 폭동이 더 일찍 안 일어난 게 이상하죠

translation.en: It was just like one of them times
where the guys just say, "We're gonna show you."
[Snodgrass] I really had a lot of aggression and a lot of hatred for the system.
translation.ko: 원래 교도소 시스템에 반감과 혐오감이 컸었어요

translation.en: They took me away from my family
and sent me to prison when I was 17 years old.
You've gotta understand, I was forced
to fight every day in order to survive.
translation.ko: 싫어도 날마다 싸움질을 해야 살아남을 수 있었어요

translation.en: You're either gonna become a solid dude, or you're gonna be a little bitch.
translation.ko: 성깔 있는 놈으로 안 보이면 찌질이 취급당하니까

translation.en: I learned the best thing to do is stand up for yourself at all times.
translation.ko: 언제든 스스로를 지키는 게 상책이란 걸 배웠죠

translation.en: Okay, I'm locked in here, but still, I'm a human being.
translation.ko: 빵에 좀 왔다고 내가 짐승이라도 돼?

translation.en: Still I'm a man.
Still I want that respect that you want.
Y'all can just say, "Fuck me."
No, fuck y'all.
[Tate] By the time I got there at about six o'clock...
the perimeter of the prison was totally ringed
with State Highway Patrol.
To any bad situation, you have a window of opportunity
translation.ko: 아무리 상황이 불리해도 더 악화되기 전에

translation.en: where you can infuse a gun team,
whatever, and quell a problem
before it just keeps magnifying.
That didn't occur.
[man] We knew that some inmates had been killed.
We knew there were hostages in there.

They've killed a hostage.
They've got six or eight other hostages or however many at that point.
What's gonna happen now?"
[Guynes] I had read a book called A Time to Die,
translation.ko: ‘어 타임 투 다이’란 책을 읽은 적이 있죠

translation.en: about the prison riot in 1971 at Attica in New York.
translation.ko: 1971년 뉴욕 애티카의 교도소 폭동을 다룬 책이에요 “애티카 폭동 진압 중 37명 사망”

translation.en: And I knew that when they came in...
they killed most of the hostages.
The guards included.
And so I was thinking all the time...
that they might bum-rush us and do the same thing.
translation.ko: 경찰이 우리를 쫓아내고 똑같은 짓을 하지나 않을까

translation.en: When you murder an officer, negotiations stop. We're coming in.
translation.ko: 교도관을 죽이면 협상은 없어요 무력 진압이 시작되는 거죠

translation.en: And they were scared to death the SWAT teams would come rushing in
translation.ko: 놈들은 SWAT팀이 진입하고 사람들이 죽어 나갈까 봐

translation.en: and a lot of people would start dying.
[woman on TV] People tell us the killing makes them want authorities to storm the prison.
translation.ko: 이번 교도관 피살로 주민들은 무력 진압을 찬성 중입니다

translation.en: Told them they were gonna kill 'em anyway,
and I truly think if they would have went in at the beginning, I mean--
It's happening anyway.
We figured, "Yeah, it won't be long before they make a move on us."
They come in here, they're gonna come deep
and they're gonna kill as many people as they can possibly kill.
They'll probably-- Everything standing up is getting shot.
translation.ko: 눈에 띄는 족족 쏴 버리는 거예요

translation.en: [Rice] The pressure to attack...
became very, very great.
[Snodgrass] We had a lot of intelligent people in there.
translation.ko: 우리 쪽에도 머리 좋은 친구들이 많은 덕에

translation.en: We made a maze with all the bunk beds out of the cells,
translation.ko: 감방의 이층 침대를 끌고 나와 미로를 만들었어요

translation.en: that way the officers couldn't rush in there
and just run through the block. They had to go through our maze.
translation.ko: 경찰이 우리한테 바로 들이닥치지 못하고 이리저리 헤매게 말이에요

translation.en: We had guys that had served in Vietnam.
We had a guy, he built these bombs out of lighters. [chuckles]
You know, and he was good at it, too.
[Rice] Petitions were actually being circulated to, you know,
go in there and get those SOBs
translation.ko: 당장 진입해서 자신의 권리를 스스로 내던진

translation.en: because they've given up all their rights.
[Snodgrass] We had weapons set up in our block, like this volleyball bar.
translation.ko: 우리 구역을 무장시켰어요 배구 네트 같은 걸 썼죠

translation.en: We brought that from the gym, tied a sheet on each side of it.
Seventy or eighty pounds of solid steel coming from the ceiling,
and if you released it, anything in its path, it's wiping out.
translation.ko: 건드리면 밑에 있는 것들을 다 쓸어버리게 만든 거죠

translation.en: Art was carrying the weight
of the world on his shoulders.
It was damn lonely.
Damn lonely.
I mean, it's one of the loneliest jobs a person can have, I think.
translation.ko: 교도소장은 아마도 세상에서 가장 고독한 자리일 겁니다

translation.en: Bob was killed in the morning, on Thursday,
translation.ko: 놈들이 목요일 오전에 로버트를 죽였기 때문에

translation.en: so the afternoon shift came in with fire in their eyes.
translation.ko: 오후 교대로 들어온 대원들은 적개심에 가득 차서

translation.en: They wanted an immediate assault.
"God damn it! They're gonna kill the rest of these people.
We need to get in there now!
We've got all the weaponry. We've got this, we've got that."
So I'm trying to pull...
everything from the reserve tank. [chuckles]
I said, "Look, assaulting L-Block right now
is only gonna cause a lot more bloodshed,
and we don't need that."
Well, it worked.
After that little speech,
I went back into a restroom.
I totally lost it.
So...
I got it-- I pulled it together
and things started happening pretty quickly then.
I know in my heart that tonight's the night. I know that.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤이 고비라는 거 잘 알고 있다

translation.en: I know that if we don't go out there and do something,
as you've got it set up, and you're blowing and coming in here.
translation.ko: 바로 쳐들어올 준비가 돼 있다는 것도

translation.en: I know that.
We know that your end resolve is to kill as many of us as you can.
translation.ko: 우리를 최대한 많이 죽이는 게 그쪽의 최종 목표지?

translation.en: We know that.
What happened, George? Did you lose control?
I never had control.
I'm just a negotiator. I'm just one man.
George, if you get me one hostage and you,
translation.ko: 조지, 인질 하나를 더 보내 주면

translation.en: I'll sit down face-to-face on live radio.
translation.ko: 자네와 라디오 생방에 나가 얼굴을 맞대고 얘기하겠네

translation.en: You owe me that much.
Can I come out there and talk to you on live radio, just me?
translation.ko: 나 혼자 밖에 나가 라디오에서 당신과 얘기하라고?

translation.en: No, one hostage with you.
I can't do that.
Yes, you can, George.
Put a stop to this in a peaceful, orderly manner.
translation.ko: 난 사태를 평화적으로 순조롭게 해결하고 싶네

translation.en: I want nobody else hurt.
[Rice] George was able to come out and broadcast,
translation.ko: 결국 조지는 교도소를 나와 방송에 출연하고

translation.en: to get their thoughts out to the public.
[Skatzes] My brothers, if you can hear me on that radio, please holler at me!
translation.ko: 형제들, 라디오에 내 목소리 나오면 소리 질러

translation.en: I think he was just wanting to let people know
translation.ko: 조지는 사람들한테 자기가 이른바 거물이란 걸

translation.en: that he was the big cheese, if you will.
[Skatzes] We hope there is no more violence.
We hope there are no more unnecessary murders.
Okay.
From the onset of this,
we have tried desperately, desperately, desperately
to get in contact with the news media.
We have beat our brains out,
we have been stopped by this administration.
They think they can confine this incident within the walls of this prison,
translation.ko: 그들은 이번 사태를 교도소 담장 안에 감추고

translation.en: like no part of the world can hear this.
[Rice] He had a little trouble with the language
and putting his thoughts together.
It was more off-the-cuff type things.
translation.ko: 준비 없이 되는 대로 말하는 거 같았어요

translation.en: [Skatzes] Okay, I'm very limited in time. I'm sorry.
[stammers] I mean, the list of demands and all like that
is by no means short, I could rattle on forever.
Now, we are releasing one Darrold Ray Clark Jr. here,
translation.ko: 먼저 이 담장 반대편에 있는 대롤드 클라크를

translation.en: on the other side of this fence.
[woman on TV] 23-year-old corrections officer Darrold Clark
was freed after prison officials agreed to allow inmates
translation.ko: 교도소 관계자가 재소자들에게 라디오 방송에서 성명을 발표하게 해 준 결과

translation.en: to make a statement on local radio.
[Rice] That was a trade-off. We got a hostage,
and we were getting hostages out any way we could.
translation.ko: 인질을 살리기 위해선 뭐든 할 생각이었거든요

translation.en: Their mind games start to break you down.
They're swinging ball bats over my head, against a brick wall,
translation.ko: 머리 위로 배트를 휘둘러 벽을 때리거나

translation.en: sharpening knives,
and things like saying they're going to throw my guts in my face.
translation.ko: 내장을 꺼내 얼굴에 던지겠단 말을 하는데

translation.en: That's enough to break anybody.
[woman on TV] There is expected to be anotherlive broadcast later this morning.
translation.ko: 오늘 오전 또 다른 생방송이 계획돼 있으며

translation.en: Another hostage is supposed to be freed.
[Tate] Jim Demons was being held by the Muslim group.
translation.ko: 짐 디먼스는 이슬람 그룹에 잡혀 있었는데

translation.en: He apparently told them,
"I'll convert to Islam if you'll let me go."
So, shit, the next thing we know,
he comes out on the yard in traditional Muslim garb.
translation.ko: 짐이 이슬람 전통 의상을 입고 뜰에 나왔으니 말이에요

translation.en: My name is Officer CO Demons. My Muslim name is Mustafa Akhmed Lee.
translation.ko: 전 교도관 짐 디먼스로 이슬람 이름은 무스타파입니다

translation.en: If you know you're gonna be released and that's what you need to do,
probably 99 out of 100 people would say,
"You know what, put one of those damn things on me, and give me one of those robes,
translation.ko: ‘아무리 희한한 옷이라도 주는 대로 입을 테니’

translation.en: and I'm outta here."
[woman on TV] But then, a bombshell.
Now I knew Vallandingham. He was a good friend of mine.
The only reason that man is dead, 'cause he stayed in there so long,
translation.ko: 그 친구가 왜 죽었게요? 거기 너무 오래 있어서예요

translation.en: 'cause they wanna cut off water and turn off electricity,
which had me scared for my life in there.
So I adjusted to the Nation of Islam. Can y'all hear me in there?
translation.ko: 그래서 이슬람교로 전향했어요 거기 죄수들, 내 말 들었지?

translation.en: [woman on TV] Demons muttered angrily at negotiators
as he left the prison yard and shrugged off an offered jacket.
translation.ko: 제공된 재킷을 벗어 던진 채 교도소를 떠났습니다

translation.en: [Tate] When Jim Demons was released,
every employee in the prison turned their backs on him...
'cause they thought he was a traitor for converting to Islam.
[man] I understand now you wanna make a clarification.
Well, clarification is that I said what I had to say.
translation.ko: 해명하자면 해야 할 말을 한 겁니다

translation.en: I said whatever it took to make the inmates in there happy,
translation.ko: “석방된 인질” 재소자들 기분 좋게 하고 동료 교도관들의 안전을

translation.en: and to make sure that those officers in there were safe there.
[man] So you didn't believe any of that that we just saw?
translation.ko: 그럼 이전의 말은 진심이 아니란 건가요?

translation.en: No, I haven't. No, I didn't.
You have obviously been through an ordeal.
Are you going to have problems resuming your former duties?
Right now, I have no idea what I'm gonna do.
[Rice] It was kind of a strange thing to begin with,
but we really didn't care because we got another one out.
translation.ko: 하지만 뭐 어떻습니까? 인질을 더 구한 게 중요하죠

translation.en: Demons' story is certainly chilling,
especially since there are five guards still being held hostage.
translation.ko: 교도관 5명이 여전히 인질임을 감안할 때 더욱 충격적입니다

translation.en: Now, if we had to do that a couple times, fine. Didn't care.
translation.ko: 어찌 됐든 상관없었어요 몇 번이든 계속해야죠

translation.en: [chuckles] We'd just keep bringing the hostages out.
[Hensley] You can't show emotion, so you have to just deal with it.
translation.ko: 감정을 드러내면 안 돼요 그저 버텨야죠

translation.en: If I had concentrated on my family,
if I had concentrated on...
food, water,
any of those other things would've just gradually wore me down and broke me down.
translation.ko: 쓸데없는 감정 소모는 사람을 점차 무너뜨릴 뿐이죠

translation.en: You know, the administration, it seemed like it was doing nothing.
And we just felt like we was just,
you know, left pigs to slaughter or whatever.
They didn't care about us any longer.
We didn't matter.
I had a young family I needed to take care of...
translation.ko: 전 보살펴야 할 어린 자식들이 있었어요

translation.en: and I knew my wife could survive, but we'd only been married a few years,
translation.ko: 아내는 잘 이겨냈겠지만 결혼한 지 몇 년도 안 되어

translation.en: so I didn't want her to have to do that on her own.
translation.ko: 홀로 애들을 키우는 신세로 만들고 싶진 않았죠

translation.en: [Skatzes] A list of demands.
[stammers] Excuse me if I seem to rattle on.
I've got so much on my mind that I can't possibly keep it in order.
translation.ko: 머리가 복잡해서 정리가 잘 안 되네요

translation.en: As the days went on, George's role diminished
as the "hostage negotiator" for the inmates.
Another voice became more prevalent for the Brotherhood,
and that was Jason Robb.
Hey, George.
No, this ain't him. He went to get him some rest.
translation.ko: 조지는 쉬어야 해서 내가 대신한다 “제이슨 롭”

translation.en: I'm here to take care of this.
I need to talk to George. He and I have been working on things.
translation.ko: 기존에 논의하던 게 있으니 조지와 얘기하겠다

translation.en: I've been right here with him.
I hear everything he has to say.
Okay.
Jason Robb was known as "The Mayor."
[Jason Robb] We knew that this was a chess game that we're playing.
There's gotta be a way out of here, with minimal damage towards them and us.
translation.ko: 양측 모두 피해를 최소화하는 해결책을 찾고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: We knew what their end game is,
that's get-back, revenge.
Our end game is trying to get out alive.
I knew the system.
I've been down since I was 17.
And I knew when they were bullshitting and when they weren't.
translation.ko: 거짓말할 때와 아닐 때를 구별할 수 있죠

translation.en: [Rice] When the inmates took over the L-Block,
they took over the offices in L-Block.
And, unfortunately,
our disturbance control manual was in L-Block.
translation.ko: 교도소의 폭동 대응 매뉴얼이 거기 있었어요

translation.en: So we were actually negotiating against our own manual.
translation.ko: 결국 우리의 매뉴얼을 상대로 협상을 하는 셈이 됐죠

translation.en: We were reading their book, and we knew what their book said.
translation.ko: 매뉴얼을 읽어서 내용을 다 알았던 덕분에

translation.en: Once you read the book, it's quite clear.
So in the book, they were basically saying you need to wear them down.
translation.ko: 책 내용은 기본적으로 상대를 지치게 하라는 거였어요

translation.en: You need to wear down their psyche, their mentality...
And that's what they were doing, day after day.
They were slowly trying to wear us down.
We just had to incorporate what they had in the manual.
We just had to use reverse psychology on them.
We had to do to them what they were doing to us, basically.
translation.ko: 결국 우리에게 하는 걸 똑같이 해 준 셈이죠

translation.en: Jason, Jason, Jason...
Now we can play these games.
This "Jason, Jason, Jason" shit. Okay?
Now, we're not going to play games.
translation.ko: 근데 어쩌나? 난 이 게임 싫은데

translation.en: The cards are in our hands, and you understand that.
I've given you TV time. I've given you radio time.
translation.ko: 내 덕에 TV, 라디오 전국 방송까지 타 놓고서

translation.en: I've given you national media.
Oh, but you got two officers.
We've made a lot of progress,
and I just want to see us continue to move forward.
If we end it peacefully, we don't storm.
[Robb] It was the retaliation thing we worried about.
They tell us our word doesn't mean shit,
so their word doesn't mean shit to us.
We had to have something in writing,
a contractual type of agreement between us that's binding.
translation.ko: 상호 합의하에 만들어서 구속력을 가지는 계약서요

translation.en: [Rice] The inmates wanted to have an attorney,
and the one that they decided they wanted was Niki Schwartz out of Cleveland.
I think they felt this is someone outside the system.
This is an independent person
who's going to look out for our best interests.
translation.ko: 자기들 이익을 잘 대변할 거라 판단했나 봐요

translation.en: I think they needed me because, as I quickly found out,
translation.ko: 왜 저를 불렀는지 금방 알 수 있었죠

translation.en: they were talking at each other and not talking to each other.
translation.ko: 양측이 일방적인 얘기만 하느라 대화에 진전이 없었어요

translation.en: I had had a lot of experience dealing with prisoners
and dealing with prison administrations.
And I thought I had a feel for how to relate to each.
translation.ko: 그래서 양측 입장을 이해하고 잘 중재할 수 있겠다 싶었어요

translation.en: Hello, this is Niki Schwartz speaking. Your name?
My name's Jason Robb.
Hey, Jason. How are you?
[Robb] I'm making it. [Niki Schwartz] Okay.
Now we wanna be able to come out here and confer with you.
translation.ko: 이쪽에서 당신을 만나 상의할 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Right now, I'm talking to you on the phone.
I wanna talk to you face-to-face, eye-to-eye.
[Schwartz] I understand. [Robb] For a man...
to talk to another man, eye-to-eye.
[chanting] Free our guards! Free our guards!
Free our guards! Free our guards!
[Schwartz] It was decided that they would put tables on either side of the inner fence.
translation.ko: 테이블을 사이에 두고 마주 앉아 얘기할 수 있도록

translation.en: So it was as though we were talking across the table to each other.
translation.ko: 내부 철망의 양쪽에 테이블을 놓기로 했어요

translation.en: Law enforcement was very concerned about my safety.
translation.ko: 경찰은 제 안전 문제로 우려가 컸죠

translation.en: [Robb] We didn't know what to expect.
Nervous is an understatement.
We'd been in that cave the whole time with no lights.
translation.ko: 불도 안 켜지는 그 동굴 같은 곳에서

translation.en: Coming out, getting hit with that sunlight and stuff.
I don't know how to put it into words, man.
translation.ko: 뭐라 표현할 수 없는 기분이 들었어요

translation.en: There was a lot of snipers on the roof trying to conceal themselves.
translation.ko: 옥상에선 수많은 저격수가 몸을 숨기고 있었죠

translation.en: I was hoping and praying that the state would not do something foolish.
translation.ko: 당국이 엉뚱한 일을 벌이지 않기만을 기도했어요

translation.en: [Robb] They had us stop and raise our hands and strip down
translation.ko: 우리를 멈추면서 손을 들고 옷을 벗으랬어요

translation.en: so they could see that we didn't have no weapons and stuff on us.
translation.ko: 무기나 위험한 물건이 없는지 확인하려던 거죠

translation.en: When we got up to the table and sat down with Niki,
we needed to make sure who he was.
We got to see his driver's license.
[Schwartz] The first thing I said to them when I sat down, I said,
translation.ko: 재소자들을 만나서 처음 한 말이 이거였어요

translation.en: "I'm not always gonna be able to tell you what you wanna hear...
translation.ko: ‘당신들이 듣기 좋은 말만 해 줄 수는 없지만’

translation.en: but I'm not gonna give you any bullshit."
[Robb] I'm pretty good at reading people,
and he was sincere.
[Hasan] To me, he was a man that believed in standing up
translation.ko: 개인적인 입장을 떠나 진실과 정의, 평등을 위해

translation.en: for truth, justice and equality, no matter who he was for or against.
You have to trust somebody like that.
They were bright. They were articulate.
They seemed to have leadership skills,
and I think if life had dealt them different cards at an earlier stage,
they could have been responsible members of society.
I handed them a two-page document that had 21 points,
translation.ko: 재소자들의 요구 사항 21개에 대한 답변을 담은

translation.en: a response to the inmates' 21 demands.
Their first concern was, "Is this legally binding?"
translation.ko: 서류에 법적 구속력이 있냐고 먼저 묻더군요

translation.en: And I said, "No way.
You're holding hostages.
They're free to repudiate this agreement as soon as they get the hostages back.
translation.ko: ‘당국은 인질이 석방되는 즉시 이행을 거부할 수도 있다’

translation.en: But they assured me that they intended to comply with it."
[Rice] Niki is talking about reality.
Niki's saying,
"You know, there's a dead corrections officer,
there's nine dead inmates,
there's probably $20 or $30 million worth of damage.
They aren't gonna say, 'King's Act, it's all over,
you guys are going to Hawaii.'"
[Schwartz] The prisoners were most concerned
about their safety upon the surrender.
Their demands included that it be televised live.
translation.ko: 자신들의 투항 장면을 생방으로 중계할 것과

translation.en: That there be neutral observers...
because they feared retaliation from the guards.
translation.ko: 그 정도로 교도관들의 보복을 두려워한 겁니다

translation.en: [Robb] Yeah, there's a possibility
that they'll renege on a lot of these agreements.
But that's what we got the attorney for.
And these were agreements that we had made with Niki,
so I had to trust in that.
And I had to put a lot of trust in Niki, a man I'd just met.
translation.ko: 안 지 얼마 되지도 않은 그를 전적으로 믿어야 했어요

translation.en: They were ready to surrender.
[Orr] If you've just joined us, this is live coverage,
translation.ko: 방금 채널 돌리신 분들께 알려 드리자면

translation.en: a special report from Lucasville
with the good news that the 11-day siege now has ended.
[man on TV] They have reached an agreement.
It sounds like Niki Schwartz was pivotal.
He must have worked some sort of magic with these inmates on the inside.
They trusted him enough to agree to end the siege today.
translation.ko: 그에 대한 신뢰가 있었기에 농성을 끝내게 된 거죠

translation.en: [Orr] In an hour or two,
this evacuation, as they call it now, will begin.
Lo and behold, the doors opened,
and we see these guys come out in small groups.
[man on TV] And here we have some inmates coming out.
[woman] I wanna point out, all of these are inmates.
There have been no hostages released.
No hostages have been released. These are inmates.
[Orr] I just remember standing there,
actually kind of awestruck that we're actually--
This is actually happening. We're seeing this.
[Guynes] I wasn't ready to come out.
I wasn't ready to come out.
I... enjoyed my freedom.
I do remember sitting by a window, looking out.
It rained all day long.
I said, "I know them state troopers is mad as hell.
They standing out there in that rain."
[Orr] What you're watching is continuous live coverage
translation.ko: 여러분은 현재 전례 없는 역사적인 순간을

translation.en: of truly a historic and extraordinary event.
There are five prison guard hostages still inside.
translation.ko: 인질이 된 간수 5명은 아직 교도소 내부에 있습니다

translation.en: [Hensley] Everybody got real tense and quiet, so I knew something was going on.
translation.ko: 다들 말이 없고 긴장했기에 무슨 일이 있구나 싶었죠

translation.en: And they come to my cell,
and said, "Have you heard that we're surrendering?"
I said, "Yeah, right."
I really thought they were gonna kill me.
He just didn't have the guts to tell me.
translation.ko: 배짱이 없어 말을 못 한다고 생각했죠

translation.en: He said, "Nobody's gonna lay a hand on you."
translation.ko: 아무도 날 안 건드릴 거라고 하더군요

translation.en: He said, "I give you my word." I said, "I want more than your word."
translation.ko: 장담한다기에 더 확실한 게 필요하다 했죠

translation.en: I said, "Let me put my hands around your neck while we walk out, then."
translation.ko: 제가 ‘밖으로 나갈 때 네 목을 잡고 가겠다' 했어요

translation.en: I said, "Anybody touches me, I choke you to death."
translation.ko: ‘누가 날 건드리면 네놈 목을 졸라 버릴 거야’

translation.en: He said, "Deal."
[woman on TV] Prison officials here are still not in charge of what's going on.
translation.ko: 교도소 관계자들이 아직 현장을 접수하지 못한 가운데

translation.en: The inmates still have five hostages.
[Hensley] I thought they were just taking me someplace else to kill me.
translation.ko: 날 죽일 곳으로 데려가나 보다 생각했어요

translation.en: We turned that corner, and it was like a breeze hit me.
And I thought, "Damn, we really are going out.
We really are." [laughs]
[woman] This is interesting. The first time we've seen 'em with hands on their shoulders.
translation.ko: 흥미롭게도 손을 들고 나오는 이들을 처음 보았을 때는...

translation.en: [man] Could those be hostages?
translation.ko: 흥미롭게도 손을 들고 나오는 이들을 처음 보았을 때는... 인질들일까요?

translation.en: [woman] These might be the hostages.
[man] We've just been told they may come out with the last group.
translation.ko: 인질들은 마지막 그룹과 함께 나온다고 했으니

translation.en: So you may be looking at the hostages. Let's take a close look at this.
[woman] Here is what looks like another hostage.
[man] I think if you could listen real close, you could probably hear some cheers...
translation.ko: 자세히 들어 보면 격려의 말소리가 들려요

translation.en: -[woman] I hear it, Mark. Yeah, I do. -[laughs] ...from across the way.
[Hensley] If I'd have got my hands on a shotgun,
I'd have started blasting inmates.
I didn't care who, which ones.
It didn't matter.
I wanted revenge.
It's sickening. It's a sickening feeling to have.
But I had it.
[man on TV] This just into us from the State Corrections Department officials.
translation.ko: 방금 주 정부 교정국 관계자가 전해 온 소식입니다

translation.en: All five hostages have been released. We'll try to come up with...
translation.ko: 인질 5명 전원이 석방됐습니다 이후 소식도 계속해서...

translation.en: [Guynes] I was one of the very last to come out.
When I came out...
somebody locked the door
and threw the keys up on the roof.
They stripped us naked...
and then had us go sit up in the gym.
About 2:00 or 3:00 in the morning,
they load us up on three buses and took us away.
[Tate] You know...
there isn't a day that goes by that I don't think about what happened.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 하루도 안 빼놓고 날마다 생각납니다

translation.en: And I still get, you know, a little emotional about it.
I really wanted to do the best I could do down there.
When society wrings itself out of these people,
translation.ko: 세상이 이런 사람들을 사회 밖으로 쥐어짜 내서

translation.en: they're put in-- they're put in prison.
And we're then entrusted to deal proactively with them.
translation.ko: 우린 기존의 제도에 따라 그들의 관리를 위임받게 됩니다

translation.en: And it's just a huge, huge responsibility.
[Hensley] A lot of people wanted to blame Tate.
A lot of people wanted to blame the correction officers.
"It was all their fault."
It was none of that. It was the inmates.
Nobody destroyed that place,
nobody murdered those inmates...
nobody murdered Bobby, except the inmates.
The crime scene was tremendously huge.
There were over 1,200 pieces of evidence that they had to dig through.
To categorize it, to tag it,
to photograph it, to mark it for prosecution.
translation.ko: 사진을 찍은 다음 기소를 위해 표시를 했어요

translation.en: They did a tremendous job.
[Peggy Vallandingham] Did they get everyone that was involved?
They got as many of them as they could get.
They had to plea bargain with some of them...
translation.ko: 그중 일부와 유죄 인정을 대가로 거래를 한 건데

translation.en: and is that hard to swallow?
You betcha.
It's very hard.
But... without them, we wouldn't have the ones we have.
translation.ko: 하지만 덕분에 책임자 몇몇을 처벌하게 됐죠

translation.en: Mm-hmm. I know I snitched.
I gave up information on guys to the authorities, right?
It makes no difference to me if you're judging me
translation.ko: 댁이 뭐라 한대도 상관 안 해요

translation.en: and you're judging me, you're judging... you and anybody else
wants to judge me for it, fine, man. Judge me, all right?
Put yourself in my shoes, you know...
See how you handle that situation.
I don't think most people
would still have enough mind to be sane after all the shit that I've seen and done
translation.ko: 거기서 못 볼 꼴 다 보고 망할 폭동까지 겪으면서

translation.en: and been through in that fucking riot.
You know?
[clicks tongue] That's how I feel, man.
It's been a long one.
[man] The jury in this case, find the defendant, Jason Robb,
guilty of aggravated murder as it stands charged...
[Robb] At the end of the day, somebody has to pay.
translation.ko: 이제 다 끝났으니 누군가 대가를 치러야죠

translation.en: Somebody has to answer. They need somebody to be the sacrificial lamb.
They didn't have anyone to point a finger at except for the people
who were actually in the forefront as far as negotiations.
translation.ko: 전면에 나서서 협상에 임했던 우리밖에 없었죠

translation.en: I felt that law enforcement wanted to pin the death of the guard on them,
translation.ko: “실력자” 경찰은 폭동에서 주도적인 역할을 한 데 따른 응징으로

translation.en: to punish them for their role in the riot,
translation.ko: 교도관 살인에 대한 책임까지 그들에게 전가한 것 같지만

translation.en: when in fact, it's very arguable whether they had any role in the death or not.
translation.ko: 그들이 실제 살인에 관여했는진 논란의 여지가 있죠

translation.en: So, I-- I think that the-- the-- the death penalties are--
are troubling to me.
If these guys who were the negotiators for a peaceful surrender are executed,
translation.ko: 협상으로 평화적인 투항을 이끈 이들이 사형을 당한다 칩시다

translation.en: next time there's a prison riot, nobody's gonna be willing to come forward
translation.ko: 그럼 이후 교도소 폭동에선 중재 역으로 나서려는 사람이

translation.en: to be a peacemaker.
[Vallandingham] As long as they get what's coming to them...
and ultimately that's death.
And I do live for that day.
[man on radio] ...but some of those storms could be strong to severe
and accompanied by high wind...
[Hensley] I was able to go back and face it.
I was able to walk back in that place 121 days later.
I was able to overcome it and do my job professionally.
translation.ko: 그제야 악몽에서 벗어나 프로답게 임무를 다하게 됐죠

translation.en: But I had to prove to myself that I could do that...
translation.ko: 할 수 있다는 걸 입증해야 했고

translation.en: and I did it.
I never retaliated against one inmate...
translation.ko: 그때 일을 두고 재소자 그 누구에게도

translation.en: for the entire thing.
-[cell door buzzes] -So I knew I did okay.
At least I knew I was still human.
